KeyboardAxisCamera.name: KeyboardAxisCamera
KeyboardAxisCamera.description:
A **KeyboardAxisCamera** lets you switch a {{#crossLink "Camera"}}{{/crossLink}} between preset left, right, anterior, posterior, superior and inferior views using the keyboard. ## Overview
  • If desired, you can have multiple KeyboardAxisCameras within the same {{#crossLink "Viewer"}}{{/crossLink}}.
  • Multiple KeyboardAxisCameras can drive the same {{#crossLink "Camera"}}{{/crossLink}}, or can each drive their own separate {{#crossLink "Camera"}}Cameras{{/crossLink}}.
  • At any instant, the KeyboardAxisCamera we're driving is the one whose {{#crossLink "Camera/active:property"}}active{{/crossLink}} property is true.
  • You can switch a KeyboardAxisCamera to a different {{#crossLink "Camera"}}{{/crossLink}} at any time.
## Example

props.name: id
props.description: Optional ID, unique among all components in the parent viewer, generated automatically when omitted.

props.name: meta
props.description: Optional map of user-defined metadata to attach to this KeyboardAxisCamera.

KeyboardOrbitCamera.name: KeyboardOrbitCamera
KeyboardOrbitCamera.description:
A **KeyboardOrbitCamera** lets you orbit a {{#crossLink "Camera"}}{{/crossLink}} about its point-of-interest using the keyboard's arrow keys. ## Overview
  • Orbiting involves rotating the {{#crossLink "Camera"}}Camera's{{/crossLink}} {{#crossLink "Camera/eye:property"}}{{/crossLink}} position about its current {{#crossLink "Camera/look:property"}}{{/crossLink}} position.
  • The orbit is freely rotating, without gimbal-lock.
  • If desired, you can have multiple KeyboardOrbitCameras within the same {{#crossLink "Viewer"}}{{/crossLink}}.
  • Multiple KeyboardOrbitCameras can drive the same {{#crossLink "Camera"}}{{/crossLink}}, or can each drive their own separate {{#crossLink "Camera"}}Cameras{{/crossLink}}.
  • At any instant, the KeyboardOrbitCameras we're driving is the one whose {{#crossLink "KeyboardOrbitCamera/active:property"}}active{{/crossLink}} property is true.
  • You can switch a KeyboardOrbitCameras to a different {{#crossLink "Camera"}}{{/crossLink}} at any time.
## Example

props.name: id
props.description: Optional ID, unique among all components in the parent viewer, generated automatically when omitted.

props.name: meta
props.description: Optional map of user-defined metadata to attach to this KeyboardAxisCamera.

KeyboardPanCamera.name: KeyboardPanCamera
KeyboardPanCamera.description:
A **KeyboardPanCamera** lets you pan a {{#crossLink "Camera"}}{{/crossLink}} using the W, S, A and D keys. ## Overview
  • Panning up and down involves moving the {{#crossLink "Camera"}}Camera's{{/crossLink}} {{#crossLink "Camera/eye:property"}}{{/crossLink}} and {{#crossLink "Camera/look:property"}}{{/crossLink}} positions along the direction of its {{#crossLink "Camera/up:property"}}{{/crossLink}} vector.
  • Panning backwards and forwards involves moving the {{#crossLink "Camera"}}Camera's{{/crossLink}} {{#crossLink "Camera/eye:property"}}{{/crossLink}} and {{#crossLink "Camera/look:property"}}{{/crossLink}} positions along the direction of its {{#crossLink "Camera/eye:property"}}{{/crossLink}} - {{#crossLink "Camera/look:property"}}{{/crossLink}} vector.
  • Panning left and right involves moving the {{#crossLink "Camera"}}Camera's{{/crossLink}} {{#crossLink "Camera/eye:property"}}{{/crossLink}} and {{#crossLink "Camera/look:property"}}{{/crossLink}} positions along the the vector that is perpendicular to its {{#crossLink "Camera/up:property"}}{{/crossLink}} and {{#crossLink "Camera/eye:property"}}{{/crossLink}}-{{#crossLink "Camera/look:property"}}{{/crossLink}} vector.
  • If desired, you can have multiple KeyboardPanCameras within the same {{#crossLink "Viewer"}}{{/crossLink}}.
  • Multiple KeyboardPanCameras can drive the same {{#crossLink "Camera"}}{{/crossLink}}, or can each drive their own separate {{#crossLink "Camera"}}{{/crossLink}}.
  • At any instant, the KeyboardPanCameras we're driving is the one whose {{#crossLink "KeyboardPanCamera/active:property"}}active{{/crossLink}} property is true.
  • You can switch a KeyboardPanCameras to a different {{#crossLink "Camera"}}{{/crossLink}} at any time.
## Example

props.name: id
props.description: Optional ID, unique among all components in the parent viewer, generated automatically when omitted.

props.name: meta
props.description: Optional map of user-defined metadata to attach to this KeyboardOrbitCamera.

KeyboardZoomCamera.name: KeyboardZoomCamera
KeyboardZoomCamera.description:
A **KeyboardZoomCamera** lets you zoom a {{#crossLink "Camera"}}{{/crossLink}} using the + and - keys. ## Overview
  • Zooming involves moving the {{#crossLink "Camera"}}Camera's{{/crossLink}} {{#crossLink "Camera/eye:property"}}{{/crossLink}} closer and farther to its {{#crossLink "Camera/look:property"}}{{/crossLink}} position.
  • If desired, you can have multiple KeyboardZoomCameras within the same {{#crossLink "Viewer"}}{{/crossLink}}.
  • Multiple KeyboardZoomCameras can drive the same {{#crossLink "Camera"}}{{/crossLink}}, or can each drive their own separate {{#crossLink "Camera"}}{{/crossLink}}.
  • At any instant, the KeyboardZoomCameras we're driving is the one whose {{#crossLink "KeyboardZoomCamera/active:property"}}active{{/crossLink}} property is true.
  • You can switch a KeyboardZoomCameras to a different {{#crossLink "Camera"}}{{/crossLink}} at any time.

MousePanCamera.name: MousePanCamera
MousePanCamera.description:
A **MousePanCamera** lets you pan a {{#crossLink "Camera"}}{{/crossLink}} using the mouse. ## Overview
  • Panning is done by dragging the mouse with the left and right buttons down.
  • Panning up and down involves moving the {{#crossLink "Camera"}}Camera's{{/crossLink}} {{#crossLink "Camera/eye:property"}}{{/crossLink}} and {{#crossLink "Camera/look:property"}}{{/crossLink}} positions along the direction of its {{#crossLink "Camera/up:property"}}{{/crossLink}} vector.
  • Panning left and right involves moving the {{#crossLink "Camera"}}Camera's{{/crossLink}} {{#crossLink "Camera/eye:property"}}{{/crossLink}} and {{#crossLink "Camera/look:property"}}{{/crossLink}} positions along the the vector that is perpendicular to its {{#crossLink "Camera/up:property"}}{{/crossLink}} and {{#crossLink "Camera/eye:property"}}{{/crossLink}}-{{#crossLink "Camera/look:property"}}{{/crossLink}} vector.
  • If desired, you can have multiple MousePanCameras within the same {{#crossLink "Viewer"}}{{/crossLink}}.
  • Multiple MousePanCameras can drive the same {{#crossLink "Camera"}}{{/crossLink}}, or can each drive their own separate {{#crossLink "Camera"}}{{/crossLink}}.
  • At any instant, the MousePanCameras we're driving is the one whose {{#crossLink "MousePanCamera/active:property"}}active{{/crossLink}} property is true.
  • You can switch a MousePanCameras to a different {{#crossLink "Camera"}}{{/crossLink}} at any time.

classitems.name: className

classitems.description:
Begins flying this CameraFlyAnimation's {{#crossLink "Camera"}}{{/crossLink}} to the given target.
  • When the target is a boundary, the {{#crossLink "Camera"}}{{/crossLink}} will fly towards the target and stop when the target fills most of the canvas.
  • When the target is an explicit {{#crossLink "Camera"}}{{/crossLink}} position, given as ````eye````, ````look```` and ````up```` vectors, then this CameraFlyAnimation will interpolate the {{#crossLink "Camera"}}{{/crossLink}} to that target and stop there.

swing away from its {{#crossLink "Camera/eye:property"}}look{{/crossLink}} position as it flies to the target.

classitems.description:
Attempts to pick a {{#crossLink "GameObject"}}GameObject{{/crossLink}} at the given Canvas-space coordinates within the
parent {{#crossLink "Scene"}}Scene{{/crossLink}}.

Ignores {{#crossLink "GameObject"}}GameObjects{{/crossLink}} that are attached
to either a {{#crossLink "Stage"}}Stage{{/crossLink}} with {{#crossLink "Stage/pickable:property"}}pickable{{/crossLink}}
set *false* or a {{#crossLink "Modes"}}Modes{{/crossLink}} with {{#crossLink "Modes/picking:property"}}picking{{/crossLink}} set *false*.

On success, will fire a {{#crossLink "Canvas/picked:event"}}{{/crossLink}} event on this Canvas, along with
a separate {{#crossLink "GameObject/picked:event"}}{{/crossLink}} event on the target {{#crossLink "GameObject"}}GameObject{{/crossLink}}.

classitems.description:
Generic map of IDs to items - can generate own IDs or accept given IDs. IDs should be strings in order to not
clash with internally generated IDs, which are numbers.

Adds an item to the map and returns the ID of the item in the map. If an ID is given, the item is
mapped to that ID. Otherwise, the map automatically generates the ID and maps to that.

id = myMap.addItem("foo") // ID internally generated

id = myMap.addItem("foo", "bar") // ID is "foo"
Removes the item of the given ID from the map and returns it
